segmentation.segment: Market open on weekdays 8 a.m.-1 p.m.
In summer ferry connection from North Harbour (at the end of Aleksanterinkatu (Alexander Street)
The ticket covers the return ferry trip.
No admission fee to the Zoo area.
LINNANMÄKI FUN FAIR and Peacock Variety
Motor boat connection from the end of Laivurinkatu
every bright night from 7 p.m. until 10 p.m.

Museums, art galleries etc. are normally closed on all religious holidays (Christmas, Easter, Whitsuntide etc.) i.e. on the first day of the holiday and on the eve of a holiday, also on Maundy Thursday evening and Good Friday, besides 1st May and 6th December (Independence Day).
The numbers within brackets refer to the maps in the brochure "Museums and Exhibitions in Helsinki".
Bus to Leppävaara via Tarvaspää (platform 31 B at bus station) or tram number 4 to Munkkiniemi.
A walk of 500 or 1500 m respectively to musem.
MINERALOGICAL MUSEUM OF GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF FINLAND
From terminus a walk of 700 m to museum
groups of more than 20 persons half price
admission free for groups of more than 10 persons with leader
Buss no 24 from the Erottaja Square
Ferry from South Harbour every hour from 7.30 to 21.30.
COAST DEFENCE SECTION OF THE MILITARY MUSEUM
EXHIBITION OF SAFETY AND SOCIAL WELFARE
EXHIBITION OF ARABIA ART CERAMICS AND HOUSEHOLD WARE AND NUUTAJÄRVI GLASS
(during large special exhibitions higher admission fees possible)
In addition to the above there are several specialist museums in Helsinki.
The City Tourist Office will be glad to give further details.
Visitors are conducted round the building on weekdays at 2 p.m. and on Sundays at noon and 1 p.m., except on days when Parliament is in full session and holidays.
Foreigners and groups by special appointment.
Public admitted to public galleries when Parliament is in full session
